name: Continue
description: The server has received the request headers and the client should proceed to send the request body.

name: Switching Protocols
description: The server is switching protocols as requested by the client.

name: Processing
description: The server has received and is processing the request, but no response is available yet.

name: OK
description: The request succeeded. The meaning of 'success' depends on the HTTP method.

name: Created
description: The request has been fulfilled and resulted in a new resource being created.

name: Accepted
description: The request has been accepted for processing, but the processing has not been completed.

name: Non-Authoritative Information
description: The server is a transforming proxy that received a 200 OK from its origin, but is returning a modified version of the origin's response.

name: No Content
description: The server successfully processed the request, but is not returning any content.

name: Reset Content
description: The server successfully processed the request, and asks that the user agent reset the document view.

name: Partial Content
description: The server is delivering only part of the resource due to a range header sent by the client.

name: Multiple Choices
description: The request has more than one possible response. The user agent or user should choose one of them.

name: Moved Permanently
description: The URL of the requested resource has been changed permanently. A new URL is given in the response.

name: Found
description: The URL of the requested resource has been changed temporarily. A new URL is given in the response.

name: See Other
description: The server sent this response to direct the client to get the requested resource at another URI with a GET request.

name: Not Modified
description: Used for caching purposes. Tells the client that the response has not been modified, so the client can continue to use the same cached version of the response.

name: Temporary Redirect
description: The server sends this response to direct the client to get the requested resource at another URI with same method that was used in the prior request.

name: Permanent Redirect
description: The resource is now permanently located at another URI, specified by the Location: HTTP Response header. This has the same semantics as the 301.

name: Bad Request
description: The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax).

name: Unauthorized
description: The client must authenticate itself to get the requested response. (Often used for 'unauthenticated').

name: Payment Required
description: This response code is reserved for future use. The initial aim for creating this code was using it for digital payment systems.

name: Forbidden
description: The client does not have access rights to the content; that is, it is unauthorized, so the server is refusing to give the requested resource.

name: Not Found
description: The server can not find the requested resource. In an API, this can also mean the endpoint is valid but the resource itself does not exist.

name: Method Not Allowed
description: The request method is known by the server but is not supported by the target resource.

name: Not Acceptable
description: The server cannot produce a response matching the list of acceptable values defined in the request's proactive content negotiation headers.

name: Request Timeout
description: The server would like to shut down this unused connection. It is sent on an idle connection by some servers, even without any previous request by the client.

name: Conflict
description: The request conflicts with the current state of the server (e.g., a resource conflict).

name: Gone
description: The requested content has been permanently deleted from server, with no forwarding address.

name: I'm a teapot
description: The server refuses the attempt to brew coffee with a teapot. (A humorous April Fools' joke RFC).

name: Unprocessable Entity
description: The request was well-formed but was unable to be followed due to semantic errors.

name: Too Many Requests
description: The user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time ('rate limiting').

name: Internal Server Error
description: The server has encountered a situation it doesn't know how to handle. A generic 'catch-all' error.

name: Not Implemented
description: The request method is not supported by the server and cannot be handled.

name: Bad Gateway
description: The server, while acting as a gateway or proxy, received an invalid response from an inbound server it accessed.

name: Service Unavailable
description: The server is not ready to handle the request. Common causes are a server that is down for maintenance or that is overloaded.

name: Gateway Timeout
description: The server, acting as a gateway or proxy, did not get a response in time from the upstream server.
